text: Well upon hearing it, with one mind they called outThe Text actually says ‘they lifted voice to God’ (since God is not deaf, there is no need to shout). to God and said: “O Sovereign!Our ‘despot’ is a transliteration of the Greek word here. The term is stronger than ‘master’ or ‘lord’. But ‘despot’ by itself has a negative connotation to us, so we sometimes say ‘benevolent despot’, but not as a form of direct address! Hence, ‘sovereign’. You are God,Perhaps 2% of the Greek manuscripts, of objectively inferior quality, omit “God” (as in NIV, NASB, LB, TEV, etc.). the Maker of sky and earth and ocean, and all that is in them;
